handNote.p: Main scribe. Many appearances of tall e ligature and tall s, macron for abbreviations resembles two dots, frequent use of squarey two-stroke unroofed a with flat top. A 'less good but nearly contemporary hand' (Ker 206-210); i.e., a 'compressed' hand (Magennis 7-8). Digipal assigns the homily's main scribe to DP630 but the hand is different.

Correcting hand using comma-shaped/caret-like markings, active throughout Julius E VII, named J2 by Magennis (Magennis 8). Because of the close similarities in some active hands in Julius E VII and the likelihood that the main scribe is also self-correcting with caret markings, a number of corrections have been assigned "uncertain".

A second corrector using a very light, rather wide tool, cf. 'ongæt' on f. 130v. Also responsible for some underlinings and other interventions. Ash is of 'oe' style, flat top of g juts a bit to the left of the descending stroke, unroofed insular a in triangular shape like that of Digipal's DP0631. Not given a distinct listing by Digipal.
